intro: Isoloma venosum, commonly known as the veiny lily, is a striking perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive veined pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
